Comment: Fwiw, this complaint is an example is why it took decades for the USA to build out all of its free trade deals to the point where we had gotten into a space where tariffs were minimal or nonexistent. (before Trump blew that all up.)  There are dozens of rather powerful interest groups representing industry, labor, consumers, environment, etc. both domestic and abroad that have a stake in these trade deals. A couple of bad terms can turn any one of interest groups into a thorn that is opposing an administration.   Therefore past administrations took negotiations seriously and tried working with and shepherding all stakeholder parties into a direction that enabled freer, flatter trade.  Given though Trump's complete hold over the Republican party; it's doubtful that automakers will have much leverage to change this.
